title: Data Analyst
company_name: National Roads And Motorists' Association Limited
description:
Based at our stunning beachfront location in Coolangatta, with a hybrid work from home opportunity, a role within this reputable organisation and industry, will shape an exciting next step, in your career journey. NRMA Parks and Resorts is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the National Roads and Motoring Association (NRMA) - keeping people moving for 100 years. Our expanding portfolio of owned and managed holiday parks currently features 48 holiday parks and resorts in iconic tourism locations around Australia.

NRMA Parks and Resorts has recently invested in a sophisticated new data platform to assist us on our future journey to provide market leading guest experiences.
The Role:
To support our future growth, we are looking to onboard an experienced data analyst as an integral part of our team, reporting to the General Manager Customer, Marketing and Sales. If successful, you will manage all aspects of our new data platform, including undertaking analysis of customer data to drive key... insights to inform our guest experience, membership, marketing campaigns and operational strategy. This is an opportunity to use your skills in data analysis and segmentation to empower our team to deliver exceptional guest experiences.
Key responsibilities include:

Analysis of data sets, identify trends, share insights and make recommendations
Designing effective, user-centered reports, dashboards and visualisations
Assisting with the refinement and measurement of guest lifetime value, segmentation, and propensity model use cases
Measuring media effectiveness
Supporting the revenue team in understanding guest insights and trends
Assisting with data validation analysis and in enhancing our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) implementation
Adopting an agile delivery approach through continuous development of GCP, resulting market segmentation, reports, visualisation, and dashboards
Analysis of web and commercial data sets to identify trends and patterns
Identifying workflow automation opportunities
Preparing and maintaining technical documentation and an up-to-date repository

How Do You Measure Up?

Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar role
Experience working in a fast paced, ever-changing environment
Passion and enthusiasm for providing an exceptional customer experience and all things digital
Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field including Computer Science, Engineering, Finance or Economics (desirable)
Knowledge and experience in the travel and tourism industry (desirable)

The Perks!

Friendly hybrid working environment
Discounted NRMA insurances, FREE Premium Roadside Assist, FREE NRMA Blue Membership and other NRMA Benefits
Accommodation discounts with all NRMA Parks and Resorts across Australia

Please Note : All successful positions at NRMA Parks and Resorts will be subject to a mandatory pre-employment screening process
We are proudly diverse and are committed to fostering an inclusive culture where all people are valued, respected and able to contribute their talents to drive organisational performance. We encourage applications from people from diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
We thank you for your application in advance. Only successfully shortlisted candidates will be contacted

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Senior Data Analyst - up to £60k + 15% bonus
Retail
Hertfordshire
Do you have strong Data Analysis experience and are you looking for a new hybrid remote opportunity in Hertfordshire? Deerfoot IT Recruitment are helping a collaborative company recruit a full-time Senior Data Analyst with a salary of up to 60k p/ a and an attractive benefits package.
You will be working in a hybrid capacity at home, the office or any other relevant location, depending on the needs of the business.
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work across the entire business to define, develop, maintain and communicate data models and landscapes to support the company's business.
In your first few weeks in this Senior Data Analyst role, you can expect to:
Work with the Data Platform Manager and the senior technology leadership team to encourage the adoption of the data platform and analytics tools across the business through engagement with the business
Ensure data relationships and flows are considered, adapted... and maintained for each new project or initiative
Work with the business to capture data and reporting requirements through workshops and engagement with key stakeholders
Identify and pursue data innovation opportunities, identifying gaps in data requirements and determining solutions.
To apply for this Senior Data Analyst role, you will need comprehensive experience with Data Analysis, Data Integration and Metadata Management, including proficiency in data modelling and design.
You will also require the following:
Understanding and familiarity with Metadata management, Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence concepts
Good knowledge of data warehouse architecture
Previous analytical experience in a professional environment
Experience in implementation of GDPR regulations in projects.
Azure
Tableau
You will receive a salary of up to £60k + up to 15% bonus and an excellent benefits package in return for your knowledge, expertise and flexibility.
To apply for this inclusive and collaborative full-time Senior Data Analyst job in Hertfordshire, please contact Deerfoot IT Recruitment today.
Deerfoot IT Resources Ltd is one of the UK's leading IT Recruitment Agencies, trusted by many of the UK's leading employers. Established in 1997, we have over 25 years of experience as IT Recruitment Specialists. We will never send your CV anywhere without your authorisation and only after you have seen the complete details of this opportunity. Deerfoot is acting as an employment agency in relation to this role

title: Data And Reporting Analyst
description:
Key requirements: Reviewing the existing outdated and convoluted framework for managing finances for remote communities programs, including processes, systems, and data structures and definitions.
Developing options and an implementation plan for an improved framework to go live on 1 July 2022 that is much more streamlined and better aligned to the rest of the Department, and ensures the transition is smooth.
Undertaking a large portion of the activities identified in the above implementation plan.
Reviewing the existing archaic and highly inefficient framework for reporting on financial information related to remote communities programs and related programs.
Developing an implementation plan to transition the existing reporting framework to a more appropriate framework used by another section within AHC via the data warehouse).
Developing interim reporting solutions to meet changing information needs due to organisational changes to ensure the Department manages remote communities... finances appropriately in the interim.

Ex perience required:

Prior experience in reporting and systems role, with strong technical expertise related to data and systems.
Substantial experience with SQL, Power BI and DAX (or similar), working with data warehouses and other databases, and developing data models.
Strong technical problem-solving capabilities are also required - for example, to translate complex financial business logic to code in SQL or DAX

title: Business Analyst - Operations IT
description:
Business Analyst, Operations IT

Chennai (India), Wuxi, (China), Australia, Dublin (Ireland)

About the Operations IT Team

Operations IT is a global IT capability supporting the Global Operations Organization. We business partner with Operations capability areas: Pharmaceutical Technology Development, Manufacturing, Global Engineering, Quality Control, Sustainability, Supply Chain, Logistics and Global External Sourcing and Procurement. We operate out of Operations hubs sites including in the UK, Sweden, US, and China; and out of our Global Technology Centres in India and Mexico.

About Astrazeneca

AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven Bio Pharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies.

At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries... of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development.

About the role

Are you looking for a new challenge? Where you will support to shape the future for our business partners. By taking on the Business Analyst Role you are going to use and develop your skillset when it comes to IT, Manufacturing Systems, Automation engineering expertise and bio-pharma industry trends in order to influence and execute IT strategy and delivery in our Operations IT Team.

We are looking for a person who enjoys and strives to develop strategic relationships with Process Owners and Stakeholders, and furthermore identifies ways for IT to partner with our subject matter experts within the Manufacturing Capability to achieve and exceed business objectives.

The role focuses on driving IT Product Strategy and roadmaps, by identifying innovative technology solutions and exploiting current technology to create maximum competitive advantage to deliver business benefit.

This role requires you to flex between the capabilities for a Business Analyst and Project Manager, including successful delivery of requirement, project and products. And as the organization moves towards agile delivery the role will require you to seek opportunities to embed agile ways of working with adoption of agile techniques including scrum.

Key responsibilities
• The role comprises of a blend of accountabilities across the Business Analyst, Business Relationship Manager/Business Partner, Project Manager roles along with Agile delivery responsibilities
• Work with colleagues across the OpsIT and the C4Es, (e.g., Architects, Scaled Delivery, etc.) to identify the capabilities required to ensure outcomes/requirements are clearly understood and can be delivered.
• Provide thought leadership, innovation and contribute to the definition of the technology direction and strategy for the specialist area, to drive transformation.
• In the role as Business Analyst key responsibilities include the soliciting, understanding and prioritization of business requirements from multiple partners, including development of Business Cases. The role requires interpretation of the requirements to inform analysis, solution design, decision making and to positively impact risk and issue resolution.
• In the role as Project Manager/Scrum Master, key responsibilities include following AZ PM processes to lead and influencing teams to ensure projects are delivered timely, within budget with goals fulfilled. The role will delegate tasks within the project team and empower team members with responsibilities. It will be key to embrace scrum methodology as the organization transition to agile ways of working.

Essential experience & skills
• Experience of identification and implementation of innovative technology solutions
• Experience of input to business strategies and influencing the vision of senior leaders
• Experience of leading business cases
• Experience of delivering projects
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills including presenting
• Excellent influencing, networking and team working skills
• High level awareness and interest of developments in the Information Technology trends.
• Knowledge in planning, change management, agile and problem solving
• A proven track record of delivering results
• Experience of bio-pharma industry desirable

Why join us

Here our work has a direct impact on patients – transforming our ability to develop life-changing medicines. We empower the business to perform at its peak and lead a new way of working, combining ground breaking science with leading digital technology platforms and data. All with a passion to impact lives through data, analytics, AI, machine learning and more. Join us at a crucial stage of our journey in becoming a digital and data-led enterprise. Make the impossible possible by building partnerships and ecosystems, creating new ways of working and driving scale and speed to deliver exponential growth. Focused and committed, and backed with the investment to succeed, we’re driving cross-company change to disrupt the entire industry.

In addition you will also join an inspiring and expert team, where we continuously introduce new theories, shares insights and lessons and have an open culture where we encourage each other to share thoughts. We are open to hearing what interests you have and ensure we invest time to develop you in your future path.

FOLLOW US

Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn

Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook

Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram

Date Posted

03-Feb-2023

Closing Date

09-Feb-2023

AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements

title: Research Analyst
description:
Job Description We are Australia’s largest superannuation fund, here to help members achieve their best possible retirement outcome. We create meaningful value for members and our communities through our diverse workforce of high performing, motivated employees, based across Australia.
Genuine Hybrid working
Exciting growth, coupled with support to help you develop your career
Market Research Analyst look for their next career step

Your new team

The Customer Strategy & Insights Department guides decision makers across the Fund to consistently set, monitor, and adjust the Fund’s collective customer strategy across Product, Service, Distribution, Positioning and Policy, Marketing/Brand activities. CSI provide insights through customer analytics, customer research, voice of customer and performance measurement to inform Fund wide decision making. CSI is a trusted adviser and strategic guide for departments cross the entire Fund.

Your new role

The Research Analyst supports the design... implementation and dissemination of customer research projects across the Fund, working with an established team of 3 market research specialists.

You will be involved in delivering end-to-end research projects; from extracting member sample, preparation and programming of surveys, monitoring and collection of data, data cleaning and weighting, right through to report writing (in both Word and PowerPoint), dashboard design, and disseminating actionable insights to inform key business decisions across the Fund.

You will be curious, driven and passionate about understanding members, with a keen eye for detail, and a desire to tell a story through numbers.

What you’ll need
Recent graduate or a few years experience within a customer reporting function such as Customer Analytics, Research, Customer Insights, Demographics, Consumer Statistics.
Knowledge of Market Research and associated techniques.
Experience with survey/market research platforms such as Qualtrics, Medallia, InMoment.
A self-starter with high attention to detail, the ability to be adaptable and possess a positive attitude.
Team player with excellent communication skills.
Very well organised, adherence to process and be able to multi-task while meeting multiple deadlines.
Experience using the Microsoft suite of programs.

What you’ll get in return

You will be working with a People Leader who values and supports your personal growth, in a growing, dynamic and authentic organisation that promotes integrity and puts members first.

We are proud to be a WGEA certified Employer of Choice for Gender Equality (since 2012). We are committed to the recruitment, development, and support of a diverse workforce into an environment which is inclusive, embraces diversity in all its forms and is a place where you can be you.

All roles can flex at AustralianSuper, and we are happy to discuss what this can look like for you . Please talk to us about the flexibility you are seeking, and we will explore what is possible for this role.

Other benefits include a competitive salary, genuine flexible working arrangements, income protection insurance and generous leave entitlements.

What’s next

Please apply now, if you share our values of Energy, Integrity, Generosity of Spirit and Excellent Outcomes and would like the opportunity to work in a challenging, growing and rapidly evolving team to deliver outstanding results.

Progress, powered by purpose .

Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by AustralianSuper’s Recruitment team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you

title: 3Rd Party Resource Analyst Hce2146
description:
We believe in better. And we make it happen.

Better content. Better products. And better careers.

Working in Tech, Product or Data at Sky is about building the next and the new. From broadband to broadcast, streaming to mobile, SkyQ to Sky Glass, we never stand still. We optimise and innovate.

We turn big ideas into the products, content and services millions of people love.

And we do it all right here at Sky.

You will be joining a dynamic Data Engineering team, working within Sky’s Data organisation. You'll help with the day-to-day management of a large group of 3rd Party Data Engineers provided by a variety of 3rd Party Vendors.

The role includes supplying to the organisation, data management and process improvements used to own the team whilst working closely with other teams and Squads within Sky Data and our 3rd party vendors.

Typical daily tasks include handling, supporting, and communicating end to end with our 3rd party community including onboarding new joiners... offboarding our leavers and our contractor base.

What you'll do

You will be processing data through a variety of Sky Systems
Collaborate closely with 3rd party vendors and internal Sky Data teams to provide the supply of people to meet the resource demands from our team
Support the team operationally with some light touch technical support whilst ensuring we are aligned with Sky’s internal processes.
Provide data analysis and support to the 3rd Party Resource Lead and other Sky Data Managers as well as some Project Management opportunities.

What you'll bring
A self-starter attitude with proven organisational and communication skills
You'll prioritise your workload and have a keen attention to detail
You will also have a passion for learning new systems, building new process including workflows and for working collaboratively both internal and external to Sky Data.
A logical approach to data and be comfortable in leading, organising and presenting data
Experience in office tools such as Microsoft Office, Teams, SharePoint and PowerPoint. Exposure to Workday and Beeline is desirable but not crucial.
Practical experience of Project Management will be a bonus

Global OTT Technology

Our team develops and supports best-in-class video streaming services, underpinned by pioneering engineering principles. We do this at huge scale: for over 50 million customers globally, spanning NBCUniversal Peacock in the US and Sky, NOW and SkyShowtime across Europe. No matter the device, the time or the place, we make sure that our diverse audiences can easily find and enjoy whatever they want to watch, choosing from the world’s best entertainment, news and sport.

The rewards

There's one thing people can't stop talking about when it comes to #LifeAtSky: the perks. Here’s a taster:
Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place
The magic of Sky Glass at a best-in-class rate
A generous pension package
Private healthcare
Discounted mobile and broadband
A wide range of Sky VIP rewards and experiences

Inclusion & how you'll work

Recognised by The Times and Stonewall, we take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion. Investing in society, fighting racial injustice and setting daring targets for representation at Sky.

We’ve adopted hybrid working and split our time between outstanding office spaces and the convenience of working from home. You’ll find out more about what hybrid working looks like for your role later on in the recruitment process.

Your office space

Osterley

Our Osterley Campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Gunnersbury, Ealing Broadway and South Ealing tube stations. There are also plenty of bike shelters and showers.

On campus, you’ll find 13 subsidised restaurants, cafes, and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed, and even get pampered at our beauty salon.

We'd love to hear from you

Inventive, forward-thinking minds come together to work in Tech, Product and Data at Sky. It’s a place where you can explore what if, how far, and what next.

But better doesn’t stop at what we do, it’s how we do it, too. We embrace each other’s differences.

We support our community and contribute to a sustainable future for our business and the planet.

If you believe in better, we’ll back you all the way.

Just so you know: if your application is successful, we’ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer

title: Business Analyst (Cross-Border Data Transfers)
description:
Your new company

The company is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
Your new role

The Legal and Compliance Department is establishing an Information Management team in Hong Kong to focus on the firm’s strategic initiatives in China.

Its primary mandate includes rolling out an operating model governing cross border data transfers in addition to other Information Management’s overall book of work in this region.

Based in Hong Kong, this opportunity will provide the individual with a chance to work with a wide audience from different departments, jurisdictions, and seniorities to drive key business initiatives.

Key Roles and Responsibilities
• Involve in the control and maintenance of a key artifact referred as the Master Data... Transfer Inventory (MDTI) actively
• Perform implication analysis related to the regulatory changes and how it might affect existing data transfers’ classifications
• Assess various data transfer requests in response to changes to the Firm's China’s operating model
• Produce and communicate analysis outputs and findings to stakeholders
• Contribute ideas to the overall design of China’s operating model and specific control framework around the MDTI
• Involve in other Information Management’s book of work as needed

What you'll need to succeed
• Around 3-5 years of experience, preferably 2+ years working in financial industry
• Expertise in data manipulation using MS Excel including usage of VBA, Power Query
• Demonstrable experience in enterprise-wide programs
• Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to learn and to deal with ambiguity on the job
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to create high quality deliverables that are comprehensive, accurate, and customized to audience across levels and cultures
• Self-motivated individual and creative thinker who will take ownership of tasks and manage time effectively and independently
• Familiarity with various data regulations such as PIPL, GDPR, CAC assessment an advantage
• Business fluent Mandarin an advantage
• Other data/business intelligence platform knowledge an advantage

What you'll get in return
• The opportunity to work in a top-tier global investment bank
• The opportunity to collaborate with like-minded individuals
• The career development opportunities with attractive salary

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV.
At Hays, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they can flourish and succeed. We actively encourage people from diverse background to apply

title: 2023 University Graduate (U.S.) - Information Management Data...
description:
Requisition ID: 261779

Overview

Bechtel is among the most respected engineering, project management, and construction companies in the world. Bechtel operates through global business units that specialize in energy, infrastructure; mining and metals; nuclear, security and environmental with focused teams working with customers, partners, and suppliers on diverse projects in nearly 40 countries.

The Energy Global Business Unit - Information Systems and Technology organization seeks a junior intro level Information Management (IM) Data Analyst. This position will utilize enterprise level Information Management systems and practices and will play an important role of sharing of information and data collection amongst our clients, vendors, and partners towards achieving business goals and objectives.

Work Location: Energy GBU in Houston, Texas

General Job Duties

Responsibilities include:
• Provide Data Analytic duties;
• Collaborate with business process owners to help understand... the data and identify opportunities for improvement.
• Compiling reports;
• Analyzing data and building dashboards etc., (data visualization)
• Check consistency across several data sources and business processes
• Data extraction, analysis, and data validation
• Establish KPIs to measure progress and quality
• Troubleshooting and resolving data quality and integrity issues
• Participate and facilitate turnover of information to the client

Basic Qualifications:
• Completed four-year Bachelor of Science degree program in Engineering with a minor in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Information Technology, Information Systems Management, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering from an accredited college or university
• General knowledge of engineering best practices and standards
• Possess advanced level Windows applications knowledge
• Advanced MS SQL/Oracle PL/SQL languages
• Experience with reporting tools such as Power BI and SSRS
• Possess the eligibility to work and remain in the U.S without sponsorship
• Some travel may be required

Preferred Qualifications:
• Excellent written and oral communication skills
• Basic knowledge of digital-twin science and technologies
• Awareness of CFIHOS/ JIP36 data modeling standards
• General knowledge of CMMS and Enterprise Asset Management
• Knowledge of Hexagon SmartPlant suite a plus
• Prior co-op or internship experience is a plus

Shaping tomorrow together

Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Oil, Gas & Chemicals; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.

www.bechtel.com

Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

In accordance with Bechtel's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace for our employees and to safeguard the health of our families, customers, and visitors, we have adopted mandatory COVID-19 safety protocols for each work location, which may include a vaccination or testing requirement. Please speak with your Bechtel recruiter to determine which protocols apply to the work location for the job you are seeking.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Description

The Senior Data Analyst coordinates with other analytics, IT and business areas across the organization to ensure work is completed with insights from knowledge SMEs.

The Senior Data Analyst work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.

Responsibilities
The Senior Data Analyst leverages its advanced knowledge of data, modeling, optimization, and tools. Applies disciplined analytics to predict behavior and optimize programs and products to maximize revenue growth.

Utilizes advanced or predictive modeling to develop, test and validate cases that improve the outcomes and quality of the programs we offer.

Contributes to more innovative approaches to financial models as it builds knowledge of the business context in which it operates.

Understands and analyzes complex data, articulates to various units within the company at the appropriate level, impacts the... business from mathematical concepts which have a potentially sizeable dollar impact on the business.
Begins to influence department's strategy.

Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction.
Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree with 5 years of data analytics experience, or a Master's degree with 3 years of experience
• Experience with data mining, predictive modeling techniques and using data to drive business outcomes and decisions
• Proficient in a programming language such as SAS, Python, Java, Scala, C or R
• Intermediate knowledge of all Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
• Ability to self-motivate & work independently, with a strong attention to detail, to comprehend & analyze data to metrics, to solve problems
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills necessary, with the ability to present findings and insights to senior leadership & other cross functional areas.
• Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences

Preferred Qualifications
• Advanced Degree
• Six Sigma certification
• Expertise in data mining, forecasting, simulation, and/or predictive modeling
• Preferred technologies such as SAS, QL, Python, Power BI, Azure, or similar tools

Additional Information

\#LI-ER1

Scheduled Weekly Hours
40

title: Data Engineer
description:
Servian is an award-winning, people-focused, global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps/Cloud, Digital, Machine Learning and Cyber Security. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has on us and our clients. As a Servianite you will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of interesting projects, using a variety of emerging technologies. title: Senior Data Analyst - Strategic Sourcing (Minneapolis, MN)
description:
Description:

At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe...

Position Summary

The Senior Data Analyst will collaborate with Strategic Sourcing for STERIS to create an overall analytics strategy for the department. You will be responsible for planning, organizing, and executing analytics in order to identify risk and create more effective and efficient ways related to strategic supply chain Management. This position will require prior experience with industry standard software tools and technologies. This involves gathering data requirements, report development, testing and support for analytical and operating systems, and potential development of supplier facing applications/portals. The incumbent will be the Subject Matter Expert in the Supply Chain related applications, visualization in Tableau and/or Power BI, and will partner with the sites and sourcing teams to create new businesses processes and practices to help the Global Strategic Sourcing Organization operate in a World-Class manner. The position will require learning to implement the analytics processes on the department toolkits and generally staying abreast with changes in technology.

Duties
• Provides an understanding of business and data requirements, and design visualizations for initial concepts and prototypes that can be presented to Strategic Sourcing, the business, and supply chain partners.
• Assist department leader with establishing overall analytical strategy and roadmap
• Closely work with IT BI team to develop existing technology that enables quicker and better analytics
• Performs detailed data analysis (determine data structures, content, and quality of the data through examination of source systems)
• Designs and creates data visualizations (reports and dashboards) using Tableau or Power BI as required.
• Responsibility for managing and executing Supply Chain systems and processes focused on sourcing, supplier relationship management, new product development, procure to pay cash cycles, Supplier facing forecasting along with system development/improvement. The individual will need to work as part of a regional and/or global team to improve and meet business targets.
• Develops and produces spend analysis, savings reporting, and other metrics to enable communications and decision making
• Serves as SME (subject matter expert) on business intelligence database and online sourcing tools
• Assists with Business Process development as it relates to systems for SS
• Supports the training and usage of data analytics capabilities within the Supply Chain and operations teams
• Work with Sourcing colleagues to continuously improve the department and achieve department goals.
• Identify and resolve data quality/integrity issues
• Troubleshoot BI and Analytics tools, systems and software; performance-tune applications as necessary
• Communicates and collaborates well with Supply Chain colleagues and the business leaders to strategize on impactful projects and deliver value added analytics to monitor key areas of the business.

#LI-BB1

Required Experience
• Bachelor's Degree
• Experience developing reports and dashboards using Tableau or Power BI (2-5 years)
• High proficiency with spreadsheet tools (Excel, Access), data warehouse/report writing packages
• Previous use of an established ERP system (SAP, Oracle) etc.
• 2-5 years Experience in Strategic Sourcing, Supply Chain or Operations or other related roles

STERIS is a leading provider of products and services that meet the needs of growth areas within Healthcare: procedures, devices, vaccines and biologics. We exist to fulfill our MISSION TO HELP OUR CUSTOMERS CREATE A HEALTHIER AND SAFER WORLD. STERIS is a $3B, publicly traded (NYSE: STE) company with approximately 16,000 associates and Customers in more than 100 countries.

If you need assistance completing the application process, please call 1 (440) 392.7047. This contact information is for accommodation inquiries only and cannot be used to check application status.

STERIS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and the use of affirmative action programs to ensure that persons are recruited, hired, trained, transferred and promoted in all job groups regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, national origin, citizenship status, military or veteran status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, and any other category protected by federal, state or local law. We are not only committed to this policy by our status as a federal government contractor, but also we are strongly bound by the principle of equal employment opportunity.

The full affirmative action program, absent the data metrics required by § 60-741.44(k), shall be available to all employees and applicants for employment for inspection upon request. The program may be obtained at your location's HR Office during normal business hours.

title: Clinical Data Analyst
description:
Clinical Data Analyst at Somatus
Remote
Description...
Somatus is looking for a Clinical Data Analyst to join our quickly growing organization. In this role, you will work with the Data Science and Clinical Informatics team to design cutting edge solutions for our clinical and operations team. Your role is extremely important in helping us tell the story through complex data sources. If you have a knack for story-telling or translating, you will be the perfect candidate!
Responsibilities:
+ This role will primarily support HEDIS reporting and Analytics.
+ Use advanced tools in Excel to create standardized reporting (ie pivots, slicers, global filters, spark lines, conditional formatting, VBA for automation)
+ Use and able to learn other BI tools such as Power BI to re-create dashboards for automation.
+ Generate insights and translate from data into meaningful impact
+ Create standardized scorecards, leading indicators, KPIs for ongoing monitoring for clinical and operations performance on effectiveness and cost impact
+ Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
+ Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Qualifications:
_Required_
+ Healthcare experience in a Payer, Provider/Hospital, Org a must
+ Knowledge of SQL, Advanced Excel functions (pivots, slicers, spark lines, VBA)
+ Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, advanced Excel) and data frameworks (e.g. Azure, Cloud) · Proven experience as a Data Analyst
+ Experience in data mining – extracting, storing, transforming
+ Analytical mind and business acumen
+ Strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)
+ Problem-solving aptitude
+ BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or relevant field; advanced degree in Data Science or other quantitative field is preferred but not required
 
OTHER DUTIES:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Our priority is the health and safety of our members, colleagues, partners, and community. Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination is required for employment. If you are unable to be vaccinated for medical reasons or sincerely-held religious beliefs, we will consider requests for reasonable accommodations consistent with our policy, and where we are able to provide such accommodations without undue hardship to the company pursuant to applicable law.
_Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions_ .
_Somatus, Inc. provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Further, the company takes affirmative action to ensure that applicants are employed, and employees are treated during employment without regard to any of these characteristics. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated

title: Data Analytics Analyst
description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Analytics Analyst to support the data pipeline strategies and objectives across the business whilst maintaining data integrity and building data reports. You will be responsible for guiding end-to-end processes, standards, and guidelines to ensure accurate and efficient data delivery of tasks and projects. This role will entail providing data-driven insights... in the form of ad hoc analyses, presentations, and automated reports, and encompass marketing, product, and finance analytics.

Responsibilities

Responsible for collecting, organizing, and analyzing data from diverse sources with a variety of BI/ Analytics tools.

Design, develop and test BI solutions such as databases, data warehouses, queries and views, reports and dashboards.

Assist with creating and maintaining technical documentation for the ETL process and BI reporting tools.

Extensible skills in data analysis, data mining and data integration.

High level of expertise with MS SQL, SSIS, and BI.

Extensive experience defining business issues, researching, collecting and analyzing data.

Ability to multi-task and re-prioritize work on short notice.

Partner with cross-functional teams to improve processes and identify ways to scale projects.

Familiarity with data exploration and data visualization tools like Power BI

Support day-to-day data processing to prepare the team in preparation of daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly reports.

Manages and designs the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.

Supports the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.

Supports initiatives for data integrity and normalization.

Assesses tests and implements new or upgraded software and assists with supporting strategic decisions on new systems.

Troubleshoots the reporting database environment and reports.

Trains end users on new reports and dashboards.

Provides technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.

Requirements

Pursuing or successfully holding a Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, finance, management science, actuarial science, or a related field

High level of expertise with MS SQL, SSIS, and BI

Exposure to working on financial accounting, regulatory reporting (FDIC, FRB), or management reporting initiatives

Experience working in a financial, risk or equivalent function

3 years of relevant experience in data analysis or analytics

Benefits

Hire Resolve is a top-tier recruitment firm that focuses on placing skilled professionals in permanent employment.

Hire Resolve focuses on working with senior-level executives and we pride ourselves on delivering excellent service to our candidates and clients.

Salary: negotiable.

Our client is offering a highly competitive salary for this role based on experience.

Apply for this role today, visit the Hire Resolve website: or email us:

Alternatively, you are welcome to connect with either Caitlin Heuer, Samantha Bradfield or Lauren van Heerden on LinkedIn

Robert Half is looking for aDATA BASE DEVELOPER / REPORT WRITER for a permanent direct hire full time position.The position is HYBRID IN OVERLAND PARK, KS.What does this position do?!You will build and maintain data sets, reports and dashboards.Manage the organizations data platforms and participate in the data strategy, using MS SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS and or any newer services with Azure and Power BI.

It is a perfect time to bring your expertise to thisposition DATA BASE DEVELOPER / REPORT WRITERat this growing company and have the opportunity for growth, development and have purpose and meaning in your work. Exceptional benefits!

Requirements:
• 5+ years of data base development, managing and creating data pipelines with experience in:MS SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS, and or any other BI Tools along with ETL functions.
• Ability to bring best practice concepts, maintain and create and support the business as the main Data Base Developer and Report Writer.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to partner with the business and IT.
• ** For immediate and confidential consideration, please send a message to MEREDITH CARLE on LinkedIn or send an email to me with your resume.My email can be found on my LinkedIn page.Also, you may contact me by office: 515-303-4654 or mobile: 515-771-8142.Or one click apply on our Robert Half website.No third party inquiries please.Our client cannot provide sponsorship and cannot hire C2C.

title: Data Analyst III (Healthcare Analytics)
description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you'll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility. Position Purpose: Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and... influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.
• Applicants for this job have the flexibility to work remote from home anywhere in the United States*Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.
Contribute to the planning and execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
Assist in the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation
Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers
Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products
Partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required
Provide technical guidance to junior analysts

Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. Master's degree preferred. 4+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management or 2+ years of IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Working knowledge of SQL/querying languages. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Preferred knowledge of modern Business Intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI.

Centene is proud to offer competitive benefits for this position. They are available for review at: https://jobs.centene.com/us/en/benefits. The salary range in CO is: $65k-95k; The salary range in CT is: $71k-99k.

Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law

description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you'll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility. Analyze health management programs including: data collection, validation and outcome measurement. May... include:
o Financial, pharmacy, claims, provider, and member data
o IRS, CMS, HHSC, HEDIS reporting
o Internal data cleansing and data reconciliation analysis
o Trend analysis in various functional areas of health care management.
Create and generate reports through MS-Excel, MS-Access, and SQL using Business Objects interface and direct links to core databases (ODS/EDW)
Produce reports for and interface with senior management and internal and external stakeholders.
Gather and interpret business requirements and monitor data trends to proactively identify issues
Execute data changes and update core systems as needed
Handle multiple projects and timelines effectively and communicate risks and issues to manager regularly
Assist with training lower level Data Analysts.

Position Purpose:
Responsible for analytical data needs. Handle complex data requests, reports, and predictive data modeling.

BUSINESS ANALYTICS:
Bachelor's degree related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience or 1+ years of related IT experience, including data warehouse, coding or ETL experience. Advanced knowledge of Business Objects, SQL, and Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access.

Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. title: Sr. Data Analyst/Engineer - Remote
description:
Job Description:
Sharecare is the leading digital health company that helps people – no matter where they are in their health journey – unify and manage all their health in one place. Our comprehensive and data-driven virtual health platform is designed to help people, providers, employers, health plans, government organizations, and communities optimize individual and population-wide well-being... by driving positive behavior change. Driven by our philosophy that we are all together better, at Sharecare, we are committed to supporting each individual through the lens of their personal health and making high-quality care more accessible and affordable for everyone. To learn more, visit www.sharecare.com .
Job Summary:
Seeking a Sr. Data Engineer to contribute to a new cutting-edge platform supporting big name partners and customers. In this fast-paced environment, the team works with Product, QA, Operations, and Analytics to meet business needs. This position is a chance to join a highly collaborative agile team working on breaking new ground in the health information industry.
An ideal candidate should be a fast learner, self-driven, and detail focused. The candidate should be comfortable with Scala or Python and related frameworks or they must have strong Java experience with a desire to learn functional programming and performing ETL and BigData processing with Spark, Hadoop, and Hive. Strong analytical skills are a must when designing our platform architecture. The candidate should be able to follow requirement documents, design future proof solutions, and voice his/her opinions on possible improvements and innovations.
Essential Job Functions:
+ Healthcare Data analysis skills across data categories - Eligibility, Enrollment, Events, Labs/Biometrics, Referrals, Med Claims, Rx Claims, Dental Claims, Vision Claims, Utilization, Dental Accumulators
+ Review/Profile Data feeds from multiple Clients/Vendors; Consistently map and confirm data to Sharecare standard format
+ Technical skills: SQL, SQL Server, RDS on Cloud, AWS and understanding file formats used on Data exchange.
+ Technical skills – ETL Development; Understanding concepts of ETL development; Understanding concepts of Data Modeling
+ Programming Languages (Proficiency in 1): Python, JAVA, R; Knowledge of any reporting Tools - Tableau, PowerBuilder is a Plus
+ Review Data related Quality Control warnings and errors across data categories
+ Monitor production runs, any operational issues and support Performance Guarantees across clients (Impacting about 10M active lives)
+ Support new strategic state implementations – performing data analysis and mapping.
+ Help improve automation of the existing processes
Qualifications:
+ Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Computer Science or a related field
+ Detail focused engineer excited to learn new technologies and solve complex problems
+ Experience programming for the JVM (Functional languages a plus)
+ A strong understanding of concurrent, parallel, and distributed systems
+ Experience with Apache Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Redshift and related technologies a plus
+ Experience with Python, Scala, SBT, and the Typesafe stack a plus
+ Experience with Amazon SNS, Kafka, Kinesis MongoDB, Kubernetes, and GIT a plus
+ Knowledge or experience in test driven development (TDD) and continuous deployment best practices
+ Experience with machine learning algorithms and big data processing a plus
+ A “can do” attitude and enjoys working within a highly collaborative and friendly work environment
Sharecare and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and E-Verify users. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, equal pay, disability, genetic information, protected veteran status, or other status protected under applicable law.
Sharecare is an Equal Opportunity Employer and doesn't discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, genetic information, protected veteran status,or other non-merit factor

title: SENIOR DATA ANALYST
description:
The Senior Data Analyst is part of a core team that enables strategic decision making throughout the company. Strong verbal and written communication, with time management skills are key to success in this role. This role will be able to consume, process and analyze the largest household goods datasets in the world in collaboration with other analysts, investigators, and subject matter experts... The right candidate should be passionate about data and analytics with a positive and solution-oriented mindset.

You are interested in this career because of your strong background with technologies like Snowflake as well as your experience building data catalogs or data dictionaries. More specifically, you are able to develop successful relationships with UniGroup business units.

The work location for this role is flexible if approved by UniGroup except this position may not be performed remotely from Colorado or California. You may read over the UniGroup privacy policy by clicking HERE.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Advocates for improvements to data quality, security, and query performance that have impact across your data domain.
• Approves data model changes as a reviewer and code owner for specific data domains.
• Builds actionable insight for the business using data visualization tools. (We use QlikSense and ThoughtSpot)
• Builds close relationships with other functional teams to truly democratize data understanding and access.
• Cleans and models large quantities of raw, disorganized data using code-based tools. (We leverage DBT)
• Clearly and concisely communicates complex business logic, technical requirements, and design recommendations through iterative solutions.
• Collaborates on SQL code base, creating analysis and transformations. Knowledge of Python, SAS, and various modeling techniques is preferred. (We use Snowflake and BI tools like Qlik and ThoughtSpot)
• Collaborates with business units across UniGroup in building self-service, dashboard, and reporting solutions to deliver useful analysis and strong data insights.
• Confidently delivers and explains data analytics methodologies and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects.
• Contributes to, implements, and maintains best practices and standards in functional areas (data warehousing, data modeling, coding, visualization, and analysis) keeping reliability, performance, scalability, security, automation, and versioning in mind.
• Effectively communicates and collaborates, including providing clear status updates.
• Engages in discussions of technical design and architecture recommendations.
• Explains trends across data sources, potential opportunities for growth or improvement, and data peculiarities to deliver descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, forecasting, and prescriptive data analysis.
• Follows and improves processes and workflows for maintaining high quality data and reporting.
• Helps to define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for our data environment. Maintains and advocates these standards through code review.
• Implements data quality tests and continuously review, optimize, and refactor data models in order to expand our data environments with ready to analyze data.
• Influences and implements service level framework SLOs and SLAs for data sources and data services.
• Influences overall objectives and long-range goals of team.
• Owns the end to end process of being on-call including reading logs, diagnosing issues, verifying and implementing solutions, and otherwise providing data support for UniGroup team members.
• Participates in data quality process and other data auditing activities.
• Proactively works on the efficiency and capacity planning to set clear requirements and reduce the system resources usage to make compute queries cheaper.
• Provides mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Data Analysts on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy.
• Solves technical problems of high scope and complexity.
• Turns learnings into repeatable actions by documenting work in the appropriate shared location.
• Performs a variety of other duties as assigned.

Education, License or Certification:
• Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Communications, Psychology, Business or equivalent experience.

Experience:
• 3-6 years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst or in related field
• Minimum 6 years of experience with SQL writing required
• Comfortable working in a highly agile, iterative environment using Jira.
• Ability to work with Git and the command line preferred
• Experience with a variety of data sources. (Our data includes many custom and internal applications, as well as Google Analytics, HubSpot, and more.)
• Significant experience in SQL and DBT required
• Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent those problems.
• Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases.
• Knowledgeable about UniGroup’s architecture, APIs, and tech stake.
• Possesses a deep understanding of how data is created and transformed through the UniGroup ecosystem to drive business operations, customer experience, service usage, and data reporting capabilities.
• Project experience working with SQL, Python, R, or other methods to generate insights.
• Self-motivated, and self-managing, with strong organizational skills.
• Understand the code base extremely well to lead new data innovation and to spot inconsistencies and edge cases.
• Understands the full data lifecycle and our common frameworks so that data can be easily integrated, modeled, and analyzed for insights.

We foster diversity, in part, by imposing a strict policy of non-discrimination. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information or other status protected by the law.

We value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and separated service members bring to our workforce. While serving our country you have gained skills such as leadership, flexibility, and agility, which will help to make you successful here. We are dedicated to supporting military families and ensuring that we provide a welcoming environment for our country’s heroes. We hope you consider joining the UniGroup family.

UniGroup is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, UniGroup will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@unigroup.com

title: Remote Senior Data Analyst (Supply Chain) - MB
description:
Talentify helps candidates around the world to discover and stay focused on the jobs they want until they can complete a full application in the hiring company career page/ATS.

Position Description...

Position Summary:

The Senior Data Analyst is a role defined within the Global Data and Analytics Center of Excellence, which provides design, development, consulting and support services to various markets. The Center of Excellence is comprised of experts in Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse software platforms, Data Architecture, Data Engineering, Data Visualization, and Data Science. The Senior Data Analyst will design and develop modern and innovative Global Analytics solutions to support Martin Brower’s strategic product and service offerings. In addition, this role will assist in establishing and enforcing the use of design and development best practices across those solutions. This role reports to the Lead Data Analyst.

Position Responsibilities May Include, But Not Limited To
• Design and develop Global Reports and Analytics using modern data visualization tools
• Work with business stakeholders to define data and report specifications
• Understand and prioritize business requirements while managing the expectations of stakeholders
• Align disparate business teams and stakeholders in the use of common Global Analytics metrics and standards
• Apply modern UI/UX design to customer-facing analytics solutions that helps drive adoption
• Define and advocate analytics best practices in the areas of data modeling, data wrangling, data visualization and data storytelling
• Work closely with key business stakeholders to anticipate future data and analytics needs and strategic opportunities
• Execute a portfolio of analytics projects that enable growth of the Martin Brower business, including enabling technologies such as self-service discovery and analytics that make it easier for Martin Brower personnel to use data to drive decisions, reduce costs, and optimize Martin Brower supply chain processes.
• Establish strong, strategic partnerships with key IT contacts, supply chain partners, Martin Brower senior leadership, and end users.
• Participate in Martin Brower global data governance processes to ensure data is both managed and used consistently and is compliant with enterprise standards.
• Participate in and drive strategy and execution for projects as appropriate.
• Other projects or duties as assigned.

Position Requirements

Required Skills and Experience:
• Bachelor’s Degree and 4+ years of related technical experience.
• Strong understanding of business process analytics and/or business process management, including common methods for deriving business value from data.
• Deep understanding and hands-on development experience within the Microsoft Power BI application, including data refresh methods, data modeling, data transformation, DAX functions, visualization techniques, content deployment and administration.
• Understanding and experience with application of modern UI/UX interfaces within data visualization solutions S
• trong teamwork and interpersonal skills.
• At least 4 years of experience in a business or business-facing IT role within a global or multinational organization, in which the following occurred:
• Demonstrated capabilities for analyzing business needs and finding solutions
• Demonstrated knowledge and real-world application of modern Business Intelligence tools
• Demonstrated experience developing and maintaining sophisticated analytics solutions in Microsoft Power BI
• Developed customer-facing business reports and dashboards using modern data visualization and UI/UX techniques
• Defined and/or employed the use of report design best practices in the areas of dimensional data modeling, UI/UX, and report performance
• Worked successfully in both Customer- and Business-facing roles
• Gathered business requirements and translated into data and/or report specifications
• Conceptualized efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems
• Developed both functional and technical subjec

title: Remote Healthcare Data Analyst UC Davis Health
description:
Another Source’s client, UC Davis Health, is recruiting a Healthcare Data Analyst to join their Department of Public Affairs and Marking team in Sacramento, California. This role can be fully remote and located anywhere in the United States! Position is required to work pacific standard time business hours.

Internally this role is titled: National Reputation Building Analyst...

In this new role as the Healthcare Data Analyst, you have a blank canvas and the ability to make this position your own. You will bring your strong analytics skills to an energetic and dynamic team. Here, you will be analyzing data and using analysis to create compelling and actionable data stories to share with key stakeholders to drive decisions to better deliver on their mission of improving lives and transforming health care.

Here is more about UC Davis Health and the Department of Public Affairs and Marketing:

The Department of Public Affairs and Marketing plans, manages, and implements strategic communications that are aimed at a wide range of key constituencies in the media, campus community, and external community. You will have the opportunity to make a large impact at the continuous improvement of UC Davis Health. You will be part of the strategic comparison of the institution's strategic plan and national ranking reports to deliver operational improvement recommendations.

UC Davis is a diverse community comprised of individuals having many perspectives and identities. We come from a multitude of backgrounds and experiences, with distinct needs and goals. We recognize that to create an inclusive and intellectually vibrant community, we must understand and value both our individual differences and our common ground. The UC Davis Principles of Community is an aspirational statement that embodies this commitment, and reflects the ideals we seek to uphold.

https://diversity.ucdavis.edu/principles-community

About the role:

Under the direction of the Director of Brand Management and Marketing and in close collaboration with the National Reputation Building Marketing Associate, this position’s role is to improve UC Davis Health’s standings in relation to national rankings. Daily work focuses on monitoring national competitive ranking landscape, analysis of complex business problems using data and reporting to provide insight to operational leaders in key areas throughout the organization. It will also include:
• Identifying and interpreting trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences.
• Working with internal business and/or clinical units to gather and understand data.
• Creating reports and analysis of rankings on a regular basis.

Your time will likely be spent as:

50%- Data analysis, tracking and interpretation

30%- Research, Strategy and Planning

20%- Reporting

What we would like to see from you:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
• 5 years of experience as an analyst and proven track record of developing highly effective reporting and data visualization tools for health institution.
• Experience working with data in relation to competitive market share, clinical data and prioritizing business opportunities. Strong data visualization skills required (well versed in cognitive psychology and principles of UI/UX) – including strong capabilities in Tableau
• Demonstrated experience and familiarity with advanced statistical and other quantitative methods for evaluating processes (Lean, Six Sigma, et).
• Demonstrated skills and experience translating nontechnical business requirements into actionable quantitative analytics.
• Proficient in querying data from multiple data systems and working within an integrated data mart environment to identify trends, issues and potential invalid data.
• Expert collaboration skills and experience with stakeholder management and prioritizing many data analytics requests.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to interact effectively, courteously and cooperatively with a wide range of individuals including: senior leadership, faculty/physicians and staff; business professionals; patients; consumers; and vendors.
• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to manage complex information, assess problems, and develop effective solutions.
• Excellent organizational skills; ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously; prioritize work independently; manage and meet multiple deadlines, work quickly and with minimal supervision, showing independent judgment, accuracy and initiative.
• Exceptional customer-service skills including problem-solving, cooperative language, empathy, flexibility, and the ability to work with clients and staff within the department for quick and effective responses and problem-resolution. Ability and willingness to support institutional customer service requirements.
• Position is required to work pacific standard time business hours.

The Budgeted Salary Range:

$90K-$110K

Salary Range:

$74,600 to $141,000

Another Source works with their clients, on a retained project basis. We are committed to building inclusive candidate pools as we partner with hiring teams. Veterans, women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply. As you read through the job posting and review the list of qualifications (required and/or preferred), please do not self-select out if you feel you do not meet every qualification. No one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to apply and share your story with us

title: Data Analyst
description:
Description:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for design, build, and iterating processes that help our organization with data visualizations for Sales, Finance, Operations and other critical data from various data systems (ERP, CRM, Marketing etc). Work will require exceptional attention to details in accuracy, performance, and alignment with organization priorities...

Position Overview

Client Fixed Video is seeking a Data Analyst to tell compelling data stories to drive better business decisions by helping us become customer obsessed. This role will help us achieve our goal of transforming data into a strategic enterprise asset that is shared, accessible, trusted, stewarded and secure. We want to grow and we need your help. For the right candidate there will also be opportunities to build machine learning products.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate a passion for asking questions and answering them with data stories, led by compelling visualizations that help drive business decisions keeping the customer experience at the forefront.

Responsibilities:

Translate complex, technical information into simple, engaging visuals that a less-technical audience will easily understand and use for actionable insights

Provide input on topics like data access, data ingestion, data transformation, database design and implementation

Developing a deep understanding of the business, its data, its patterns and our customers.

Working with data engineers to ensure we have the necessary data sources available to produce these insights.

Creating and communicating in-depth, precise reports, and work with the business to define and surface relevant KPIs

Ensure the validity and actionability of the data gathered and results surfaced to ensure they are be tied to customer and business outcomes

Skills:

Proficiency in SQL and can independently mine data to translate business data needs into creative and actionable visualizations. Python coding a plus

Expertise is the design and development of Tableau dashboards, reports and front-end visualizations and analysis with ability to tell stories with data

Experience with various types of data repositories (e.g., data warehouses, data lakes, data marts), master data management, and ETL/integration

Technical aptitude with Google Suite, Salesforce and broad awareness of other analytical tools

Experience in SaaS sales industry or a subscription based sales a plus

Qualifications:

Undergraduate Degree in Business, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field

2+ years of experience with Tableau, Salesforce, Power BI or related tool

2+ years of experience in visual reporting development, including hands-on development of analytics dashboards and working with complex data sets

title: Sr. Business Data Analyst - Remote
description:
Talentify helps candidates around the world to discover and stay focused on the jobs they want until they can complete a full application in the hiring company career page/ATS.

Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the... care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as we help advance health equity on a global scale. Here, you will find talented peers, comprehensive benefits, a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, career growth opportunities and your life's best work.(sm)

You believe data can help reshape the future, and you find yourself loving the thrill of diving into challenging analysis. At Optum, you'll find an organization that will recognize those talents and use them to help us build our next generation customer experience. Here, you will be empowered, supported, and encouraged to use your problem solving and data expertise to help change the future of health care.

The ideal candidate for this position is detail-oriented and highly innovative. He or she will also be responsible for translating business needs to IT solutions. They need to be able to thrive operating in complex and often ambiguous situations. This role is not about doing the same things over and over again - it is about advancing and integrating our customer data with pioneering approaches that have broad impact to our customer experience organization. It’s about leveraging our current foundational data infrastructure and enhancing it so that members are presented with relevant messages at the right time and in the right channel.

This person will have a high degree of individual responsibility and will be expected to quickly become a data expert within the organization. They will be comfortable working both independently and cross functionally in executing multiple data projects simultaneously. The ideal candidate will have an analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and a bias towards action.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities
• Experienced data and business analyst
• Understand and document the business requirements based on the customer’s needs. This includes understanding and evaluating the enhancement request, the business process, and general system capabilities
• Research and gain a high-level understanding of data elements and sources
• Data Profiling and Creation - in particular, experience working with streaming data sources and profiling data from JSON messages
• Define the source of data - type of ingestion, relationships, tables, variables, and transformations that may be needed
• Become a SME in how the data will be used and how it functions
• Create and ensure that artifacts are complete per the business and the artifact is ready for review with IT teams to begin the Solutioning phase of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
• Presenting ideas and findings in meetings
• Create process flows to simplify hand off from business to IT resources
• Excel at problem solving, identifying the root cause and approach a challenge in multiple ways
• Proactively troubleshoot data quality issues by identifying the root cause of data discrepancies and determining and implementing recommendations for resolution
• Work with business counterparts on operational readiness activities to ensure that necessary training and procedure updates have occurred
• Develop QA and User Acceptance Plan (UAT) and testing in coordination project and business leads
• Contribute to the execution of the Optum Consumer Experience data roadmap including initiatives related to data quality, data unification, data governance, data movement / ETL and data access
• Provide leadership and project management in a cross-team environment
• Be comfortable juggling multiple projects and constantly shifting t
